Reviews.Title: “Clean and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: msskyler
Reviews.Content: very average but inexpensive Motel. No breakfast but close to downtown and lot of restaurants. Not too noisy (street), but the bathroom fan of the next door room was very audible and annoying when it is turned on. Friendly and helpful staff. this is a 2 star location if all you want is an inexpensive room. Free WiFi and free use of computer at office. Plus free shuttle to airport from Holiday Inn Express across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful week”
Reviews.Author: CottekillJim
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a terrific trip to San Diego where I had a enjoyable and comfortable stay at The Rodeway Inn & Suites Downtown. My room was fresh and clean, the staff friendly and polite. (Always remembered my name). The 24 hr coffee was delicious. The front desk folks were charming and helpful. I had some last minute changes and instead of hearing " Well sir, you see, the hotel policy is....." I heard " No problem, we can fix that for you, there will be no fee, happy to do that....." Wow. The hotel is plain, yes, but in San Diego, who stays in their room? You can walk to Balboa Park, and that alone is a great perk. Very fair pricing as well. I will stay here again on my very next trip to San Diego and I look forward to it! Jim

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap hotel in 1950s”
Reviews.Author: Foosh9
Reviews.Content: Location is not bad, close to downtown. Hotel is a very old style motor court hotel from the 50s. Bathroom is miniscule, smaller than any hotel bathroom I've ever seen. Towels were paper thin, really not much better than paper towels. They were also filthy. Gray with stains on them that hadn't been washed out. Really disgusting. The hotel obviously hasn't had a guest with an electronic device. The only grounded outlet is in the bathroom. I had to plug my laptop in the outlet in the bathroom to charge it. Other devices- phones, wireless headsets, iPads, etc. all had to be plugged into the bathroom outlet. I guess you get what you pay for. This is pretty cheap for a downtown hotel- for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Basic no frills but helpful staff and good value”
Reviews.Author: Pheephox
Reviews.Content: Used this motell as just a stop off between flights and basically it's good value for a cheap price, nothing fancy at all, rooms were clean and decent. Staff much more helpful then often the case in this standard of hotel and this always makes a stay more pleasant!

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel in Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: suedebicycle
Reviews.Content: The Rodeway is located a few blocks north of Broadway, so fairly central and within easy walking distance of the Gaslamp District and Horton Plaza. The room was large and comfortable. The only problem with it was that on the second day I returned to my room to find the door ajar. This must have been left like this by the housekeeper. Fortunately nothing was missing. It's an inexpensive place to stay with a central location, Balboa Park and the zoo are not far away and can be reached on foot.

Reviews.Title: “Complimenting a Staff Member”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: This is not intended to be a full review but, importantly, to pass along my sincere compliments regarding the excellent service provided by ANISA TRIGG, Front Office Manager at this location. Throughout my 8-day stay she was always informative, helpful, good-humoured and attentive to all my needs and concerns. Her assistance and professional input were especially appreciated when I asked her to book me into my next stop -Las vegas. She turned what could have been a trying experience into a and easy smooth transition. You have good staff everywhere and ANSA TRIGG exemplified this standard of service at the highest level!.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and staff.”
Reviews.Author: LynneOnTrainRightNow
Reviews.Content: I hope I have the chance to come back. The room was very comfortable. I was also really happy to have a freindly staff. Anisa Trig and a man helped me a lot. It was actually fun. I had driven over 2300 miles and was tired, but I wanted to somehow find a beach. They told me of the ferry that goes to Coronado Island. Please tell Anisa and I wish I knew his name .....that I reallly appreciated their help. I took a taxi to the ferry. Then once on the island, I rented a bike. I never had time to find a beach,but the day was great. Then, when I was finally back, I came to my room 122 and it was perfect. Clean and had a small refrigerator. Just what I needed.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: MoMoBcn
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week and half there and the staff at the reception are very nice. They advise you and give you good tips to enjoy San Diego, they are always smiling and in good mood to help you anytime. Very good location close to everything at half the price of a gaslamp hotel. The room are spacious and confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Too noisy to get sleep”
Reviews.Author: Nursemaker
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were awoken at 3:00 a.m. by a group having a conversation in a high-pitched foreign dialect that resonated throughout the courtyard and through the windows. I could even hear the conversation with the pillow over my head. I opened my door to investigate (it made a loud noise when I opened it), and the conversation stopped, but started again when I closed my door. This lively conversation lasted for 45 minutes until a man in another room shouted for them to be quiet and slammed his door! I never did get back to sleep... I discovered in the morning that there was an alcove near my room that led to a staff break area behind another building---must have been laundry staff. VERY IRRITATING AS WE ARE PAYING CUSTOMERS WHO PAID TO SLEEP AND ARE THE REASON THEY HAVE A JOB. Other noise that kept me awake was the squeaky bed. The mattress is laid on a solid base, and every time my husband or I would move or roll over, the base made a loud leathery squeaking noise. The mattress was quite comfortable, however. The pillowcases were very scratchy. This motel is superficially decent, but if you can't sleep, it isn't worth any amount of money. I can put up with hearing other lodgers as they pass my room, but staff keeping the customers awake is totally unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location”
Reviews.Author: danykelly
Reviews.Content: This place was great for the price and the location. It was clean and had a comfortable bed. The breakfast was a bit pathetic though - don't expect anything other then muffins and coffee. Good traveling and staying here when on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not That good”
Reviews.Author: pahmed
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights last May with my husband and my 1.5 years son. I expected more than i found there. First we checked in at 10.00 PM and we had our 3 nights voucher distrubuted on 2 voucher, one with the first night and the 2nd with the other 2 nights from the traveling agency so when we checked in we found the receptionist a very rude person confirming that there is no rooms today 4 us becuase our reservation will strat from tomorow so i tried to tell him that the travel agency make the reservation on 2 vouchers but he still saying the same words without making any check , i asked him many times to re check until he did and found that this is a misteke from him not from the travel agaency.i asked him to harry because i need to change the diaper for my baby urgently but he still re checking in a very slow mode ignoring my words.I asked him for a room in the foirst level not the 2nd one as i have a stroller and lot of bags, he still keep saying that he has no room in the 1st floor till i told him that i came here expecting another attitude from this hotel as my travel agaency is the one recomended this hotel to us and they told me that this hotel is great. I told them also that i will not recomend you to any other guest and i will say all what happened to the agency so that they wont recomend you to any one and i will say this online to any link to this hotel.Aftera ll these conversations, they gave me a room in the 1st floor but they never tried to be nice with us.In addition that the parking is not free and it is costy.Also they offer complimentry breakfast but not good.Also at night, we cant sleep at all beacuse there were some guests open their doors and keep drinking, talking and laughing all night and the hotel left them without talking to them till i called the reception at 4.00 AM telling them that i cant sleep from this loud voice.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service, Very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Keri68
Reviews.Content: My family reserved 7 rooms at the Rodeway Inn in Downtown San Diego for my sister's wedding. At the last minute there was a snafu regarding the complimentary shuttle that we were relying on to move 17 people to the ceremony. One of the managers, Anisa, was extremely pleasant and helpful. She worked it out so that my family had exclusive use of the shuttle when we needed it. Not only that, since we had to start shuttling out at 3:30 and check-in time was 3:00, she asked Sarah to call us Monday morning to find out which rooms were in our wedding party so that those would be cleaned first, allowing us to check in by 2 o'clock and ease the time crunch. Additionally, I was very pleasantly surprised to find that our mattresses were extremely comfortable. Considering the price range I didn't expect much, but everybody in our party commented on the comfort of the beds. The hotel was easy to get to (just off the freeway), well-located for exploring Downtown and the Embarcadero, priced right, and the entire staff- especially Anisa and Sarah, was polite and helpful. I can't think of even one negative comment regarding our stay and I will be recommending the Rodeway-Downtown in the future to visiting friends and family. One other thing: About two blocks south of the hotel on 7th is a little restaurant named 7th Cafe- love it, love it, love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service for the money”
Reviews.Author: HL1098
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the hotel for one night (self pay). The front office manager Anisa Trigg was the nicest hotel manager we have met. She is very professional on all the fronts but two things really stand out: 1). We checked out the next morning, but wanted to leave our luggage there until the evening. She found a place for us. 2). After we took our luggage out in the after and moved to another hotel (business pay), we found out we left some staff in our room. We called, and she found it for us. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: daytonheadlee
Reviews.Content: Truly one of the best value hotels I have ever stayed at. Would recommend to anyone looking for a good room at an Really solid hotel. Iâ€™ve come to realize that most of the people writing on here are mainly just moaning and groaning because they expect perfection out of a discount room. Was the bed the most comfortable I have ever slept in? No. Was there an occasional loud child in the hallways? Yes. If you are looking for the most amazing room you have ever seen, go spend 300 dollars at the Hilton. IF you are looking for a nice, clean room and being able to spend your hard earned money on fun experiences, rather than somewhere you are just going to be sleeping, then stay here. You wonâ€™t regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for San Diego.”
Reviews.Author: izfo
Reviews.Content: After staying a night at a hotel in the "hotel Circle" part of San Diego (an area with tons of hotels, near a mall and convention center), I found this hotel when looking for affordable accommodation closer to downtown. I wouldn't say that this hotel is "in the heart of downtown" but it's within reasonable walking distance to the waterfront area, Balboa Park (and zoo) and the historic Gaslamp area. The staff at the front desk were very professional (their level of service was more like something you'd find at a better hotel so kudos to them)! There was a lady name Elise (or something similar) who was very friendly and very helpful in arranging a shuttle to the airport for us and recommending local attractions. The room itself was alright... average, clean, quite roomy, etc. What was NOT roomy was the bathroom. It was the tiniest bathroom I've seen at a hotel. I've read on here that several people weren't happy with the tubs, but they were ok... just deep shower stalls, that's all. Breakfast was kind of skimpy: orange juice, tea, coffee, fruit (apples and oranges), individually packaged muffins and yogurt cups.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleased!”
Reviews.Author: rloro1977
Reviews.Content: I booked this room because we wanted something that was dirt cheap but close enough to the Gaslamp District to party in. I was a little sketchy on the reviews but the almighty dollar crushed my fears. Don't be fooled by the price - the room (317) was really clean, we had a great view of the city & the price was excellent (kinda felt like I robbed them!). The front desk clerk who worked on Saturday (4/23) on the 3:30pm shift was extremely helpful & pleasant & gave us great tips as far as the beaches were concerned. I would have given the service 5 stars but the clerk that was working the front desk @ check out time was rude! I would recommend this place to family in friends - it's not the Embassy Suites but the location is great & it's clean! Oh & parking is $16

Reviews.Title: “No manager present ; dirty rooms; no promised "breakfast"; office staff indifferent.”
Reviews.Author: 24trvls
Reviews.Content: Location was great and hotel supplied free shuttle to pier/Amtrak/airport. Afternoon shuttle driver was extremely friendly and informative. Check-in at 4pm included two women at the front desk (maybe one was learning?). They seemed more concerned with themselves then pleasing us. When asked what time breakfast was, the one gal pointed to three carafe's and said coffee was in the morning. I asked (as well as another customer who came in after us) what about the waffles/juice/etc they still were advertising on their website (one of the draws for us to stay there) and she said that stopped two weeks prior. She seemed put off that I didn't "understand" that things change; that's the way it is! And besides, the hotel no longer says it has breakfast (I pointed out that the website still advertises it and the manager should at least be aware of it and please let him know). Several customers complained and we felt we should have received a break in the fee we paid to stay there based on that broken promise. Got to room, and it was dirty. We were a family of four traveling with another family of two. They gave the bigger room to the family of two (go figure). Toilet stopped up and heater wouldn't put out heat. Maintenance came (front staff seemed annoyed that we had to ask to have our heater fixed!) to fix the heater. The toilet still had issues. The next morning we chose not to have our room cleaned and took towels to front office to change them out (we did this on our previous stay here). The annoyed morning guy let us know he can't do that. We asked how to get clean towels. He said to contact housekeeping. I asked if he could do that (he apparently was on his phone with someone and hung up the cell phone to contact housekeeping). House keeping came to our room immediately with a smile on her face (what a concept!). We encountered the male desk clerk once more with his same non-chalant attitude. We asked to speak with manager. He said the manager was off for the weekend and gave us his card. Another employee told us not to waste our breath as the currently manager was not easy to work for and was more concerned making cut-backs than to please customers. I have to admit, our last stay here was wonderful, nothing like this time. Rooms are older and quite small for more than two people, and some upgrading has been done. Meets the needs of a quick place to sleep, but for longer vacations it maybe not. Was less expensive than other area Motel/Hotels. McDonalds is just down the street and there are a couple of places to get a quick bite in the area. Gaslamp is just a few blocks away as is the bus/trolley stops. Based on our last experience, I would not recommend this hotel unless you needed a one night to catch the cruise ship at the pier with the free shuttles.

Reviews.Title: “basic motel, close to Gaslamp area, OK value except for parking”
Reviews.Author: hopduvel
Reviews.Content: Standard 3-floor motel design surrounding a parking lot. Good location a few blocks from the Gaslamp district with lots of restaurants, clubs, and bars. Rooms are standard, functional, clean. A couple of times each evening, someone would push a flyer for a local restaurant under our door; otherwise it was quiet and seemed secure. There's wifi in the reception but it's weak in the rooms. The quoted price does not include a $16/day charge if you want to park a car there, which seems steep and borderline deceitful for a motel like this one. Parking outside the motel is scarce and metered, so paying the charge is pretty much mandatory if you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaLA_10
Reviews.Content: The staff here are courteous and the location is pretty good - but there are bed bugs!! I had booked two nights here, but after first night and getting 11 bug bites I quickly canceled the second night. I've also thrown away my purse and back pack. Bed bugs are a becoming a big problem. The bites themselves are annoying but will go away. If you bring the bugs home with you, it can become problem for the long term. That kind of stress is not worth the cheaper rate of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: CopacabanaGrill
Reviews.Content: Good Location. Desk staff fairly nice. Housekeepers mainly Hispanic and rude. Some appear racist, for sure. You know what I mean, they stare at some travelers like "what are you doing here," then smile and grin at the "vanilla middle class." What a shame. But I guess they have been trained by society to act that way. Ignore them and you will enjoy your stay. There is a convenience store across the street; Horton Plaza mall is about 4 blocks away; and the trolley to Tijuana is about 3 blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, nowhere near as "budget" as we imagined”
Reviews.Author: aailski
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our time here. The weather was pants compared to most times we've visited San Diego, but the Rodeway couldn't help that! The staff were really friendly and helpful and called us to let us know cabs had arrived and such, and it wasn't a great distance to the Gaslamp etc. However, coming back, it is up the worlds biggest hill, and it does threaten to kill you, but other than that, it's great! The breakfast was lovely, with a waffle maker, cereal, bagels, microwave, juice, hot drinks, and newspapers, and it set us up for the day. They have plenty of brochures in reception for what there is to do, and I'd highly recommend the zoo. The rooms were lovely and clean, and our cleaning girl, although limited in her English, tried to be as helpful as possible, and everything was cleaned daily. The only downside to our room was that we'd requested smoking and got non-smoking, but there was a wooden plant box with trees in it that we sat on to have a smoke.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy but reasonably priced and had all of the conveniences”
Reviews.Author: TexasWoman44
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early and were allowed to check in early. They gave us a corner room which was quiet. Smelled a little of cigarettes when we first walked in but when we turned on the AC didn't smell it anymore. Location was good a few blocks from the bus and the trolley. Did a lot of walking. Found a great little restaurant and bar on the corner across the street Sole Luna Cafe, ate breakfast there every morning, great coffee and food. Italian food served at lunch and dinner, owner's mother's authentic Italian recipes. Great bar as well.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay at The Rodeway”
Reviews.Author: zackhay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Rodeway Inn and Suites Downtown in San Diego to interview for a new business opportunity. I found the hotel using priceline.com and paid $89.00 for the night. Upon pulling up to the hotel in my vehicle I was very disappointed. It reminded me of a downtown motel from a horror movie. The room was run down and the bed was hard and uncomfortable. The only positive thing that I can say about this property is that at least the room was reasonable clean. The breakfast consisted of warm coffee (more like muddy water) and stale doughnuts. The both times that I tried to go to ask the front desk attendant a question she was too busy taking a personal call. I will definitely not stay at this hotel again and will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel stay I've ever had !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: muskteach
Reviews.Content: I am a high school teacher and took my high school group to stay at this Hotel. I booked this hotel back 6 weeks in advanced in order to avoid conflicts. The requirements I had to follow from my work place was that the hotel doors may NOT have access to the outside (but be conntected by an indoor hallway). Also ALL hotel rooms MUST be connected. ALL of these things I was promised when I made reservations NONE of them were true. ALL the rooms were on different floors and ALL had access to the outdoors (like a motel vs a hotel) and some of the rooms had only 1 bed (for 4 girls). And one room smelled like weed. There was NO accomodation they made that night, the manager was rude and going to charge us anyway. They gave us $10 off each room (WOW... for ALL of those mistakes, where I get introuble at my workplace now?) The beds sunk in like a bowl, the rooms were the most trashy and ghetto rooms I have EVER stayed in!!! I will be reporting this company to the better business bureau and will NEVER stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY...WORST HOTEL EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: deesweetest
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write reviews but I feel it's my duties to write this one: The room was very dirty!!! I couldn't sleep all night because I was itching. I felt things were biting me. I turned on the light and found bugs on my bed!!! I got over 15 bites and my friend got over 30 bites (he was a deep sleeper and didn't wake up)...I complained to the front desk and I was offered a free night...but who the HELL in their right mind would stay there another night! NOT ME!!! Trust me, don't stay there. It's NOT worth it!!! Oh, I forgot to mention, the minute I got in the room, someone called trying to scam me. They told me they were from the front desk and they need my credit card number again because their computers went down and lost all my info. I told them I'll come up to the front desk because I don't give my credit card number over the phone. I went the to front desk and they didn't know what I was talking about. DON'T EVER GIVE YOUR CREDIT CARD INFO OVER THE PHONE!!! LOTS OF SCAMMERS OUT THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable for the price we paid...”
Reviews.Author: optixguy
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious room that was quite clean. Bathroom recently painted. In-room coffeemaker and working TV. Convenient downtown location. Friendly & helpful desk staff. Minuses: (1) Casement windows that were missing parts and couldn't be closed to keep out the typical urban noise. I got one of them closed by nearly sacrificing my fingernails. (2) The couple next door had some heated discussion at 2:15 a.m. and then turned on their TV at 3 a.m. So the walls are kinda thin... If you pay more, do you get kinder, gentler neighbors? (3) Mattress was encased in crinkly plastic - OK once I got to sleep. And the sheets were too small... (4) Parking in the central courtyard was an EXTRA $14 per day. On the plus side, we paid only $73 including tax and parking, which is very, very cheap for San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “My retreat during a weekend conference”
Reviews.Author: DarrylGT
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego ..for my first time this past weekend. Stayed there from Jan 12- Jan 15 (3 nights). First things first .... Yes I was there on business .... so this means all work very little sleep ...so I decided not to spend big $$$$ ..... this hotel was perfect for the budget $99/ night via price line. This included free shuttle pick up/ drop off from airport and free continental breakfast. What ever worked out for me across the street ...the convention shuttle stopped to pick people off/ drop off ... So everything was quite easy to move around ..... like some of the other guests had shared you are walking distance to a lot of places down town ...or plan b ....a quick cab ride. As for the property itself ... well it's a hotel/ motel feel ..rooms were large ....had to request nonsmoking rooms (seems like there are still quite a few smoking rooms) ... The towels, the sheets well ...they were no Hilton/ Hyatt ..but again I paid $99/ night not $299/ night I must give a special thanks to Thomas ...who works at the front desk .... for he turned me on to a really great "locals hang out called 6 AVE BISTROâ€� ..... Not far from hotel ...(5/6 min. walk) great food .... great people ....small little place ...it so reminded me of cheers ..... i.e. Half a chicken (a very large 1/2 chicken) , beans, rice, salad, etc ...for like $12-14 It was so good ..I kept going back for lunches/ dinner and even late breakfast to watch the San Diego Charges play ...I mean kick indies butt. Hey in summary ... the place was good for me to lay my head down, close to everything .... but I wouldn't take a gal there for a romantic get away .....it's a- o- k - for solo business travelers on a tight budget ...or a cheap ..traveler like me

Reviews.Title: “Slated for demolition”
Reviews.Author: chloeandjake
Reviews.Content: Here's the deal on this Rodeway Inn...it's either owned or managed by the people across the street...Holiday Inn Express, which used to be Comfort Inn. One of the front desk people tell us it is slated to be demolished next year and a Hyatt put in its place, so don't expect any great improvements. We booked it as the Comfort Inn...how we got the Rodeway Inn is still a mystery to me. Shame on the San Diego tourism website for selling this room as Comfort Inn. We paid $126/night. As other reviewers described, early check-in not possible, but they were very accomodating storing the luggage so we could get out and about. We were told room would be ready "well before 3" but it wasn't. Someone from Holiday Inn Express must "inspect" room prior to our check-in. Here's what the inspector missed: 1. Non working light next to bed. Tried to fix this ourselves, discovering a USED condom behind the nightstand (really nice, huh?) Turned out a circuit breaker had been tripped and maintenance fixed it. "Inspector" never checked lights. 2. Non working safe. By the time it could be fixed, we were checking out. DO remember the $2 charge per night if you use the safe. Sure could have used it, but alas, the inspector "missed it." 3. Don't expect a bathtub. You get a shower pan about 42" long with a faucet like a tub. Prepare to be cramped. Ask about this before you check in. 4. Don't expect windows to properly close (sort of negates California's idea of being a "green" state when most of the a/c cooled air goes right out the window. Fortunately, we were on the third floor and didn't have to worry about someone climbing through the non-closing window. 5. Expect an odor to the non-smoking room...STALE would be a good description. 6. Worry about the elevator inspection certificate that indicated the elevator was long overdue for inspection. This has probably been fixed by now but it was not a "comfort" to see an expired inspection certificate. On the plus side: 1. Expect a decent breakfast...the lady tending the food area was very efficient and kept up with the mess left by many people. Enjoy the free USA today. 2. Enjoy Jose, the gentlemen at the front desk who tried to answer any questions we asked and was apologetic about the delay getting into our room. 3. Enjoy the complimentary airport transportation (taxi drivers can charge as much as $12. to go to the airport.) Budget hotel? Yeah, maybe, but I was hoping for at least a clean-smelling room.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and not convenient but location OK”
Reviews.Author: Quiquine
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 1 night just after staying at the Holiday Inn Express Downtown on the other side of the street. My room did not have any fridge nor any safe box. The window was old and would not close, I heard a ventilation noise all night long. I also could hear my neighbours as walls were very thin and also because most of the rooms give to the parking lot so you can hear anyone leaving or arriving to the hotel in the middle of the night. The bathroom was like a long corridor, not very convenient to get your towel on the other side of the shower... I found breakfast was not even average. I prefered the Holiday Inn Express Downtown, more modern and less noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Pony up some extra cash and stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: multisport4
Reviews.Content: First, if your looking for a deal, keep looking. This place would not be a deal if it was only 40 bucks. I've posted a review once regarding customer "no service". Well, it doesn't get any better. Stains of questionable origin, hair trimmings left around the sink, a broken remote and hair dryer, an air conditioner that rattled all night and a unfourtunate front desk clerk. I say unfortunate, because she was very polite and apologetic. She did what she could to solve the problems, but was a bit overwhelmed with many other unhappy customers. She hung in there, but was near the breaking point. She said it was constantly like that and didn't know why they didn't care to make improvements. I think she was quitting the next day. It's unfortunate for the Comfort Inn franchise when one of their franchisees leaves such a bad impression.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for area”
Reviews.Author: pr4mojo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn in October of 2005. The hotel itself was nothing special but for the price it was a great deal. You can't find a cheaper hotel in the downtown area. When I first arrived around 2pm I tried to check in early (Check-in is at 3pm) and was greeted very rudely by the person working the desk. They looked at me as if I had just killed their first born. I said, "No rooms are available for an early check in?" I was stared at and then just given a "Check-in is at 3pm". I said if I come back right at 3 are they going to be ready? Mind you I had driven over 2 hours to get there. So I drove around the city for a bit and then came back to the hotel around 2:30 and parked and waited. The attendant came out to my car and said I could check in now if I wanted to. In my opinion this made up for what I took as rudeness earlier. The room was HUGE. It had a full living room which included a couch, chair, end tables, lamps, and a TV. In the bedroom area there was another TV and two beds. I mean it was very impressive for the price and the room was in good shape. The only issue is that you are in downtown San Diego so guess what happens at rush hour? Traffic and lots of it. It was impossible to sleep past 7am when it got real heavy. The contitental breakfast was nothing special but it is free so if you complain about that, well you shouldn't. They were also repainting a lot of the rooms when I was there and re-doing the parking areas. So those improvements are on the way. Long story short, a good value in the heart of downtown and they made up for their poor service when I first arrived.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room was clean enough, though the water dripped very fast from the bathtub faucet. There was mildew on the bathroom walls. The bathroom hadn't been updated and the wallpaper was an ugly pink. I could hear the guy above me urinating and then heard a loud flush. When I took a shower, every time someone flushed the toilet, I got a blast of hot water. I reported the dripping faucet 3 times. It was never fixed, nor did they leave me a note saying that they'd tried to fix it. When I complained, they did comp me one night. Apparently, they'd have to turn off the water to the entire motel in order to fix it. The room was depressing--poor light, first floor window looked out onto a parked car. The room smelled very musty and we had to open the window to air it out. The breakfast wasn't bad, although the toasters didn't work very well.

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stylersheart
Reviews.Content: Ok where do I start??? Well the room smelled..the bathroom was filthy...there was mold in the shower...1 towel had blood on it...some guy pee'd in front of our window...the bed was hard as a rock...the pillows were sacks of flour...When I went to complain Bruce literally said "I'm waiting for the punchline - what did you expect?" and I'm not kidding! Please do not stay at this hotel unless you are in college and you don't care about the major details like getting a good nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this place!”
Reviews.Author: GC73
Reviews.Content: The staff lost my reservations from two and a half months prior and did not find me alternative lodgings, leaving me homeless the first night there. Actually, they did send me to another Comfort Inn, but their communicating skills were so poor so that didn't realize that the other site was already full, after which I received no further help to find lodging. The manager was neither caring nor bright, and contacting the owner did not resolve any of the problems I encountered. When I finally stayed there the next night, the room I was given smelled of urine, the TV had no reception, and the shower didn't drain- truly a nightmare experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: ntz4golf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn at 7th & Ash Streets from April 15th, 2005 through April 20th, 2005. I booked my room through Hotels and everything was fine when I checked in. They showed that the room was pre-paid and that was good. I asked for a room with a refrigerator but was told they were all booked. However, when I checked in, Thomas said he thought room 301 had a frig in it so he put me there. He was right. And Thomas was very helpful and cordial. In fact, everyone on staff that I met were all very professional and helpful. I found the location of this Comfort Inn to be very good-convenient to the freeways and also convenient to downtown. I like to walk to my destinations in the downtown areas and thet were all reasonably accessible. The Comfort Inn does sit up on a hill and the climb can be a little steep but we can all use the exercise, right? As far as the room, this would be the negative with my stay. The bathroom needs some serious remodeling. The bathroom floor either needs a good scrubbing or the vinyl needs replaced, maybe both. The exhaust van worked but did not exhaust the steamy air. It took a good 15-20 minutes for the bathroom to clear after showering. The shower itself was pretty small but I've never seen a shower with more water pressure than this shower! It just about took my skin off! And I loved it!!! I thought the bed was very comfortable and the cable TV provided all the channels that I needed. Being downtown and being a lowrise hotel, you heard alot of street noises but it was not a major problem. For the price, I thought I got a pretty good room in a not inexpensive city. There are some other accomodations close by-Quality Inn, Days Inn and a Best Western. You might want to research these before booking the Comfort Inn. If I could get a room at any of these places at comparable rates, I might give them a try on my next visit. Oh, about $7 by cab to the airport by the way. Not bad.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service; Lousy Facility”
Reviews.Author: ExCat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location relative to downtown, Balboa Park, the Embarcadero, and Little Italy. All of these locations are easily reached on-foot. The Convention Center seemed a bit too far to walk.The staff of the hotel worked hard and were helpful to our needs while we were there (Feb 16 - Feb 23, 2005 @ $90 per night plus tax. Free parking.). The facility itself is in serious need of renovation. Our first floor, one queen bed, room needed new carpet, new floor in the bathroom, new furniture, new windows, new shower (no tub in our room) and new lights. Mattress was so-so. This area of San Diego (I believe it is called Cortez Hill) is rapidly being converted to condos and I think the owner of this hotel is waiting for the right offer, at which time the hotel will be demolished. The best feature of this hotel is its proximity to the 6th Ave Bistro (6th Ave and B Street). Great place! Too bad the owner of the Bistro does not operate a hotel. I did discover two of San Diego's 'dirty little secrets' while we were there. First was the large number of vagrants/homeless/demented persons that we encountered on the streets of the downtown area and vicinity. I don't know if any of these persons are 'dangerous', but it did make for some unusual sights and smells while walking downtown. Second was the relationship of the airport to many of the near-northside hotels. The airport seems to have one runway, and the near-northside hotels are always in either the landing or takeoff pattern from the airport. Fortunately there seems to be a noise ordinance and planes do not seem to operate between 11:00PM and 6:30AM. But flights begin promptly at 6:30AM. The Comfort Inn-Downtown is approx 1/2 mile south of the flight path.

Reviews.Title: “It Depends On Who You Talk To”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arrival, the free shuttle bus dropped us off at the sister hotel without telling us that we were not at the Comfort. After winding our way from the drop off point in the basement garage to the elevators in the poorly lit area, we found the lobby of the sister hotel. The woman at the desk told us to walk down the stairs outside the lobby and cross the street. That was not fun carrying luggage. At the Comfort we entered the office only to be met with a young woman sitting behind the desk,who failed to say any to us until we said that we had a reservation. We had used the Comfort internet site to make the reservation; requesting an upper floor facing north or east. The woman at the desk gave us a ground floor room facing the south. At that time I knew we were in a strange hotel. The room itself was o.k.; but not worth the amount paid. The first night I went to set the alarm clock on the side table only to find it broken. It was 10 o'clock at night and since our room was near the office, I took the clock over to see if I could get a replacement. The man at the desk wasn't able to replace it but he quickly offered to set the phone system to give us a wake up call at 6 o'clock and another call three minutes after that. Nice. The following morning I checked at the desk to see if a clock radio was available only to encounter the young lady who was at the desk the previous morning. There she sat staring blindly until I asked her about the clock. Once again it was a big effort for her to reach under the counter and hand me the clock. What a creep. When we check out of the hotel, another man was at the desk and asked us how our stay was. Well I told him about the shuttle and and clock incidents. He was appalled. He asked if we need the shuttle to get to the airport and I told him I didn't want to take a chance with that again but that we wanted to leave our luggage at the hotel for a few hours as we were going to have lunch in San Diego before our flight. He was very happy to do it. A few hours later when we came to claim our luggage, yet another man was behind the desk and once again we told him of our stay after his inquiry of our visit. He insisted on our using the shuttle and called a most helpful driver to take us to the airport. I redeemed the hotel to me. 2 creeps vs. 4 nice professionals.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but rooms need an upgrade”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Comfort Inn on Ash St. in July 2004 and was under-whelmed. It is a good 20 minute walk to the convention center from the hotel, most of which is through the gaslamp district, but a few blocks are a bit sketchy. The convention I attended offered a shuttle bus to the hotel, but there was always a long line, so we walked, which was not bad. The hotel is quite centrally located to the rest of SD. Parking is a mere $6/day, although the lot is REALLY cramped and a fright to navigate. There are a lot of paint scrapes on the walls and it's no wonder! I paid $130/night before taxes for a double with one bed. I was told that was the convention rate. A buffet breakfast is included. It's just muffins and cereal and stuff, but it's not bad. There was a balcony on our room, as I think is the case on most of the rooms at this hotel. We had a fairly good view. The room itself, however, was subpar. The mirror looked like it had burn marks all over it. The door hit the toilet, the bathroom was so small. And there was a spider in the bed. We did get a mini fridge in our room, unlike the other reviewer. I would probably not stay there again, as I'm sure we could find something else a little nicer for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, 10min walk to gaslamp”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 6 nights from 22 February 2004. It was a great place to stay, the only thing I could fault would be that it sits on the top of a steep hill as you are coming from the gaslamp area (but you soon get used to it). Other than that, it was a great room, clean & tidy, staff were very helpful, I didn't have a small fridge in my room, however I'm not sure whether that is standard or not for this type of establishment. I would definitely recommend this place to stay for this lenght of time or shorter and would also stay here again if I were to return to San Diego. It also has a free shuttle which was quite handy.
